intro: Henriettella bracteosa, commonly known as the slender sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Henriettella bracteosa has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, bracteate inflorescences. It is often found in desert scrub habitats and is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
